markdown.markdown: Value-Based Marketing This course introduces modern marketing practices focused on delivering customer and organizational value. Students explore the shift from product-centric to customer-centric approaches and learn to create value through innovation, branding, service quality, and stakeholder engagement. Objective: Understand and apply value-driven marketing strategies. Data and Digital Literacy This course provides hands-on experience with R, focusing on extracting consumer insights and applying experimental methods like conjoint analysis. It concludes with an independent marketing project. Objective: Develop skills in data-driven marketing analysis using R. Agile and Sustainable Marketing Strategies This course covers ethical marketing, sustainability, and stakeholder relationships. Students learn to navigate the evolving digital landscape, with a focus on responsible communication, research ethics, and digital well-being. Objective: Master agility, sustainability, and ethics in marketing. Internet of Things (IoT) in Marketing This course explores the role of IoT devices, X-realities, and mobile apps in consumer behavior and market intelligence. Students apply their knowledge in workshops to create personalized consumer experiences while addressing social and environmental challenges. Objective: Learn to leverage IoT, X-realities, and mobile apps in marketing. Content Creation and Management This course teaches students to use tools like Google Forms and RStudio to create surveys, analyze data, and build visually compelling dashboards. It provides hands-on experience in content management and data visualization for marketing and communication. Objective: Develop skills in creating engaging digital content and visualizations. Experiential Marketing This course introduces experiential marketing, blending physical and digital experiences. Students explore how technologies like Big Data, AI, and X-realities are reshaping marketing and focus on creating engaging, interactive brand experiences. Objective: Learn to create interactive, hybrid brand experiences. Reputation and Media Management This course teaches students to manage public image, communication channels, and stakeholder relationships. Topics include public relations, media relations, guerrilla marketing, and crisis communication to protect brand reputation in a dynamic media environment. Objective: Master techniques for managing brand reputation. Data Analysis and AI This course equips students with the skills to assess data and use digital tools like gamified applications and AR technologies to interpret consumer insights and drive business decisions. Objective: Apply AI tools and digital media analysis in marketing. Academic Research Design and Consulting Practice This course teaches students research design, data collection methods, and consulting practices. Students work on real-world consulting scenarios, including business audits and marketing projects, culminating in a research or consulting proposal. Objective: Develop skills in research design and consulting. Special Topics This module covers contemporary topics in experiential digital marketing, encouraging students to engage with the latest research and industry developments. It focuses on critical analysis and evaluating the impact of marketing strategies on business and society. Objective: Explore trends and issues in experiential digital marketing. ## Programme Information - **Language of Instruction:** English - **Total Tuition Fees:** €7,500 - **Length of Study:** 3 semesters
